title: From ChatGPT to Gemini: how AI is rewriting the internet
excerpt: How we use the internet is changing fast thanks to the advancement of AI-powered chatbots that can find information and redeliver it as a simple conversation.

title: OpenAI teases ‘Deep Research’ stream at 7PM ET.
excerpt: It’s no 12 Days of Shipmas, but after a week of AI attention on the developments of DeepSeek, OpenAI has something to show off. A post on X says a livestream is scheduled for 4PM PT / 9AM JST, and we’ll add the link here once it’s available. Recent OpenAI announcements have included Sora, scheduled tasks in ChatGPT, and its computer-using Operator agent, so now we’ll see what is coming next. Update: OpenAI has announced deep research for ChatGPT, find out more here.

title: Google’s AI Super Bowl ad is wrong about cheese
excerpt: Google’s AI Super Bowl ad made a factual error about cheese, which was pointed out by viewers. The ad incorrectly stated that Gouda cheese is from France, when it is actually from the Netherlands. This mistake highlights the challenges AI faces in providing accurate information and the importance of human oversight in AI-generated content.

title: Amazon is investing billions more into its Mississippi data centers.
excerpt: The ecommerce giant will spend $16 billion building the two campuses in Jackson, MS — $6 billion more than what it originally planned to invest, according to state documents seen by Bloomberg. The biggest portion of its spending will go toward servers, fiber-optic cable, and other technology equipment, Bloomberg reports. Meta, OpenAI, and Elon Musk’s xAI are similarly pouring billions into setting up data centers across the US.

title: Microsoft is creating an “Advanced Planning Unit” to study AI.
excerpt: Just weeks after Microsoft established a new AI engineering division, the company’s AI head Mustafa Suleyman announced that the company is recruiting for another team that will examine how AI will change our world. Here’s how a job listing describes the new unit: The Advanced Planning Unit will operate in the Office of Microsoft AI’s CEO and will combine cutting edge research across Microsoft and beyond, explore and articulate a range of possible scenarios for the future of AI, craft concrete product recommendations, and suggest planning outcomes based on them.

title: GPT-5o will probably just be called GPT-5.
excerpt: That’s just one of the updates OpenAI CEO Sam Altman revealed during a Reddit AMA, saying that the launch of the next-gen model doesn’t “have a timeline yet.” Altman also hinted at updates to advanced voice mode, as well as the full release of its o3 reasoning model in “more than a few weeks, less than a few months.”

title: Microsoft Paint is getting a Copilot button, too
excerpt: Microsoft Paint is set to receive a new feature with the addition of a Copilot button. This update is part of Microsoft's broader strategy to integrate AI capabilities across its suite of applications. The Copilot feature is expected to enhance user experience by providing AI-driven suggestions and tools. This move aligns with Microsoft's ongoing efforts to leverage AI to improve productivity and creativity in its software offerings.

title: Mr. Nvidia goes to the White House.
excerpt: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, is scheduled to meet with President Trump at the White House. This meeting follows his absence from other significant tech events, including the presidential inauguration and the Stargate Project announcement. The discussion is expected to focus on Nvidia's role in AI advancements and its implications for national tech policies. This engagement highlights the growing importance of AI in governmental and technological dialogues.

title: DeepSeek: all the news about the startup that’s shaking up AI stocks
excerpt: DeepSeek, a startup making waves in the AI industry, is attracting significant attention for its innovative technologies. The company's advancements have led to a surge in AI-related stocks, reflecting investor confidence in its potential. DeepSeek's approach is seen as a game-changer, with implications for both the tech industry and financial markets. This development underscores the dynamic nature of the AI sector and its impact on global markets.

title: OpenAI launches new o3-mini reasoning model with a free ChatGPT version
excerpt: OpenAI has introduced the o3-mini, a new reasoning model that includes a free version of ChatGPT. This launch is part of OpenAI's strategy to expand access to advanced AI tools and democratize AI technology. The o3-mini model is designed to enhance reasoning capabilities, making it a valuable tool for developers and businesses. This release marks a significant step in OpenAI's mission to make AI more accessible and beneficial to a broader audience.

title: AI is ‘an energy hog,’ but DeepSeek could change that
excerpt: DeepSeek claims its AI technology uses significantly less energy compared to competitors, addressing a major environmental concern. This innovation could lead to more sustainable AI development and deployment. However, questions remain about the broader environmental impact and the scalability of DeepSeek's solutions. This development highlights the ongoing debate about AI's energy consumption and the need for greener technologies.

title: Sam Altman’s Stargate is science fiction
excerpt: Sam Altman's Stargate project is touted as one of the largest private computing infrastructure initiatives. While it promises to revolutionize data processing, skeptics warn it could become a costly failure. The project has sparked discussions about the feasibility and risks of such ambitious tech ventures. This highlights the fine line between groundbreaking innovation and speculative hype in the tech industry.

title: How DeepSeek crashed the AI party
excerpt: In a recent episode of Vergecast, David Pierce discusses the unexpected entry of DeepSeek into the AI landscape, challenging established players like Nvidia and ChatGPT. The podcast delves into how DeepSeek's innovative approach is disrupting traditional AI models. Key figures in the industry have noted the rapid advancements DeepSeek has made, suggesting a potential shift in AI dynamics. The episode also explores the implications of such disruptions on global AI strategies, particularly in regions like China.

title: Google’s Gemini AI app is getting faster with Flash 2.0
excerpt: Google has announced an update to its Gemini AI app, introducing Flash 2.0, which significantly enhances the app's processing speed. This development positions Google competitively in the AI space, as speed is a critical factor in AI applications. Jay Peters reports that the update aims to improve user experience by reducing latency and increasing efficiency. Industry experts suggest that this could lead to broader adoption of Google's AI solutions, impacting market dynamics.

title: Mark Zuckerberg to employees in leaked all-hands meeting: ‘buckle up’
excerpt: In a leaked all-hands meeting, Mark Zuckerberg addressed Meta employees, urging them to 'buckle up' for upcoming challenges. The meeting highlighted Meta's strategic shifts and the need for resilience in the face of industry changes. Alex Heath reports that Zuckerberg's message was clear: the company must adapt quickly to maintain its competitive edge. The leak has sparked discussions about Meta's internal culture and its future direction.

title: Chip race: Microsoft, Meta, Google, and Nvidia battle it out for AI chip supremacy
excerpt: The competition in the AI chip market intensifies as Microsoft, Meta, Google, and Nvidia vie for dominance. Each company is investing heavily in developing advanced AI chips to power their data centers and AI applications. The race is driven by the increasing demand for AI capabilities across various industries. Nvidia, known for its graphics processing units, is a key player, while Microsoft and Google leverage their cloud services to enhance AI processing. Meta is also making strides with its AI research and development. The outcome of this competition could significantly impact the future of AI technology.

title: Justice Department sues to block $14 billion acquisition by Hewlett Packard Enterprise.
excerpt: The DOJ is challenging Hewlett Packard Enterprise's proposed $14 billion acquisition of Juniper Networks, an AI-native network company. The DOJ argues that the acquisition would allow HPE to eliminate a smaller, innovative competitor, potentially stifling competition in the enterprise networking market. HPE and Juniper Networks have criticized the DOJ's stance as 'fundamentally flawed' and are prepared to defend the merger. The outcome of this legal battle could have significant implications for the tech industry's competitive landscape.

title: Meta’s Ray-Bans smart glasses sold more than 1 million units last year
excerpt: Meta's Ray-Bans smart glasses have achieved significant commercial success, selling over 1 million units in the past year. This milestone highlights the growing consumer interest in wearable technology that integrates seamlessly with daily life. The glasses, which offer features like photo and video capture, are part of Meta's broader strategy to expand its presence in the augmented reality market. The sales figures underscore the potential for smart glasses to become a mainstream product, influencing future developments in wearable tech.

title: Is Tesla still a car company?
excerpt: Tesla's identity as a car company is being questioned as it increasingly focuses on AI and energy solutions. The company's recent earnings call emphasized its advancements in AI technology and energy products, suggesting a shift in strategic priorities. CEO Elon Musk highlighted Tesla's AI capabilities as a key differentiator, potentially redefining the company's role in the tech industry. This evolution raises questions about Tesla's future direction and its impact on the automotive sector.

title: Google’s ‘Ask for Me’ uses AI to call local businesses for you
excerpt: Google has introduced a new AI feature called 'Ask for Me' that can make phone calls to local businesses on behalf of users. This service is part of Google's ongoing efforts to integrate AI into everyday tasks, enhancing user convenience. The feature is currently being tested and aims to streamline interactions with businesses, potentially transforming how consumers engage with local services. Google's initiative reflects the growing trend of using AI to automate routine tasks, offering a glimpse into the future of AI-driven personal assistance.

title: OpenAI targets a $340 billion valuation.
excerpt: The ChatGPT-maker is reportedly looking to raise up to $40 billion in funding at a $340 billion valuation. SoftBank would lead the round and invest up to $25 billion. SoftBank also announced last week it would be investing in a $500 billion datacenter project with OpenAI called Stargate. It's been reported that OpenAI and SoftBank will each invest $19 billion in that project. SoftBank tends to fund with debt — it already carries $150 billion on its books.

title: The too-online finance dorks are at it again.
excerpt: Incredible kicker from FT Alphaville, on top of some truly bizarre memes from Deutsche Bank. We love our blogging brethren. Deutsche Bank has published a bunch of memes about DeepSeek, highlighting the intersection of finance and internet culture. This move reflects the bank's attempt to engage with a younger, more online audience. The memes have sparked discussions about the role of humor and internet culture in traditional finance.

title: DeepSeek database left user data, chat histories exposed for anyone to see
excerpt: A breach in the DeepSeek database has left user data and chat histories exposed, raising significant security concerns. The breach highlights vulnerabilities in AI systems and the importance of robust security measures. This incident has implications for user privacy and trust in AI technologies. Experts are calling for stricter regulations and oversight to prevent such breaches in the future.

title: Inside Microsoft’s quick embrace of DeepSeek
excerpt: Microsoft has rapidly integrated DeepSeek into its Azure platform, showcasing its commitment to AI innovation. This move is part of Microsoft's broader strategy to enhance its AI capabilities and compete with other tech giants. The integration is expected to improve Azure's performance and attract more enterprise customers. Microsoft's quick adoption of DeepSeek reflects its aggressive approach to staying at the forefront of AI technology.

title: Three months with Apple Intelligence
excerpt: Apple Intelligence has been in use for three months, and the results are being assessed. The technology was expected to revolutionize user interaction with Apple devices. Early reviews indicate mixed results, with some users praising its capabilities while others highlight limitations. Apple's commitment to improving the technology is evident, and future updates are anticipated to address current shortcomings.

title: Purely AI-generated art can’t get copyright protection, says Copyright Office
excerpt: The US Copyright Office has declared that purely AI-generated art does not qualify for copyright protection. This decision stems from the notion that copyright law requires a human author, and AI-generated works lack this human element. The ruling could have significant implications for artists and companies using AI to create art. It underscores the ongoing debate about the role of AI in creative industries and the legal frameworks needed to address these advancements.

title: Microsoft makes OpenAI’s o1 reasoning model free for all Copilot users
excerpt: Microsoft has announced that it will make OpenAI's o1 reasoning model available for free to all users of its Copilot service. This move is aimed at enhancing the capabilities of Copilot by integrating advanced AI reasoning features. The o1 model is designed to improve the depth of understanding and context in AI interactions. Microsoft's decision reflects its commitment to democratizing access to cutting-edge AI technologies and could significantly impact productivity tools.

title: OpenAI is putting its o1 models on Los Alamos Lab’s supercomputer.
excerpt: OpenAI is collaborating with the Los Alamos National Laboratory to install its o1 models on the lab's Nvidia-powered Venado supercomputer. This partnership is part of a broader effort to support national security research, with a focus on nuclear security and reducing nuclear war risks. OpenAI aims to foster collaborations across various CBRN risks, emphasizing the potential for AI to contribute to global safety and security. The initiative highlights the strategic importance of AI in national defense and security.

title: DeepSeek, Stargate, and the new AI arms race
excerpt: The emergence of DeepSeek and Stargate represents a new phase in the AI arms race, with significant implications for global technology leadership. The Chinese chatbot DeepSeek and OpenAI's Stargate data center venture highlight contrasting approaches to AI development. These initiatives underscore the competitive landscape in AI, where technological advancements are closely tied to national interests. The developments raise questions about the future of AI governance and the balance of power in the digital age.

title: Poshmark is introducing AI-generated product listings
excerpt: Poshmark is rolling out a new feature that uses AI to generate product listings for its users. This tool is designed to streamline the listing process by automatically creating descriptions based on product details. The introduction of AI-generated listings aims to enhance user experience and improve the efficiency of selling on the platform. Poshmark's initiative reflects a growing trend in e-commerce to leverage AI for operational improvements and customer engagement.

title: Books written by humans are getting their own certification
excerpt: The Authors Guild has introduced a new certification to distinguish books written by humans from those generated by AI. This initiative aims to address the growing concern over AI-generated content flooding the market, which could potentially devalue human authorship. The certification will serve as a mark of authenticity, ensuring readers that the content they are consuming is genuinely human-crafted. This move comes amid increasing debates over the ethical implications and originality of AI-generated literature. The Guild's decision reflects a broader industry trend towards transparency and consumer trust.

title: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta isn’t worried about DeepSeek
excerpt: Mark Zuckerberg, CEO of Meta, has expressed confidence in the company's position despite the emergence of DeepSeek, a new competitor in the tech space. During a recent earnings call, Zuckerberg stated that Meta's focus remains on its core products and innovations, suggesting that DeepSeek does not pose a significant threat. He emphasized Meta's commitment to advancing its technology and maintaining its market leadership. This statement comes as Meta continues to navigate challenges in the rapidly evolving tech industry, where new players frequently emerge.

title: Gemini AI can automatically turn your spreadsheets into charts
excerpt: Gemini AI, a new tool, offers the capability to transform spreadsheet data into visual charts automatically. This feature is designed to streamline data visualization processes, making it easier for users to interpret and present data. The AI-driven tool aims to enhance productivity by reducing the time and effort required to create charts manually. With the increasing reliance on data-driven decision-making, such innovations are becoming essential in various industries. The introduction of Gemini AI reflects the ongoing trend towards automation and efficiency in data management.

title: Lee Zeldin, who wants to “make America the AI capital of the world” will lead the Environmental Protection Agency.
excerpt: Lee Zeldin has been confirmed by the Senate to lead the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Appointed by Donald Trump, Zeldin is tasked with promoting deregulation to boost American businesses. His agenda includes removing barriers to the construction of energy-intensive AI data centers in the US. Zeldin's leadership is expected to focus on balancing environmental policies with economic growth, particularly in the tech sector. This appointment highlights the administration's commitment to positioning the US as a leader in AI development.

title: Someone might be squatting on DeepSeek’s trademark.
excerpt: Concerns have arisen over potential trademark issues surrounding DeepSeek, a new player in the tech industry. Reports suggest that an individual or entity may be squatting on the DeepSeek trademark, which could complicate the company's branding and legal standing. Trademark squatting involves registering a trademark with the intent of selling it at a profit to the rightful owner. This situation underscores the importance of securing intellectual property rights early in a company's development to avoid legal disputes and ensure brand integrity.

title: Microsoft makes DeepSeek’s R1 model available on Azure AI and GitHub
excerpt: Microsoft has announced that it is making DeepSeek's R1 model available on its Azure AI platform and GitHub. This move is part of Microsoft's strategy to integrate more AI capabilities into its cloud services, offering developers access to advanced AI models. The R1 model is noted for its capabilities in natural language processing and machine learning tasks. By providing this model on Azure AI, Microsoft aims to enhance the tools available for developers and researchers working on AI projects. This development could significantly impact the AI community by providing easier access to sophisticated AI models.

title: This year’s Super Bowl will be full of AI ads
excerpt: The upcoming Super Bowl is set to feature a significant number of advertisements powered by artificial intelligence. This trend reflects the growing influence of AI in the advertising industry, where companies are leveraging AI technologies to create more engaging and personalized ads. The use of AI in Super Bowl ads is expected to showcase the capabilities of AI in understanding consumer preferences and delivering targeted content. As AI continues to evolve, its application in advertising could lead to more innovative and effective marketing strategies. This shift could have broad implications for how brands connect with audiences during major events.

title: OpenAI has evidence that its models helped train China’s DeepSeek
excerpt: OpenAI has presented evidence suggesting that its models have been used to train China's DeepSeek AI. This revelation highlights the complex dynamics of AI development and the sharing of AI technologies across borders. OpenAI's findings indicate that DeepSeek may have utilized OpenAI's models through a process known as model distillation. This process involves using a pre-trained model to enhance the performance of another model. The implications of this discovery are significant, as it raises questions about intellectual property and the ethical considerations of AI model sharing. OpenAI's evidence could prompt discussions on how AI models are used and shared globally.

title: Apple gets into AI: all the news on iOS 18, macOS Sequoia, and more

title: US Navy jumps the DeepSeek ship.
excerpt: The US Navy has issued a warning to its sailors against using DeepSeek, a Chinese startup's AI chatbot, due to 'potential security and ethical concerns.' This decision follows DeepSeek's recent restriction on user signups, citing 'malicious attacks.' The Navy's caution reflects broader apprehensions about the security implications of AI technologies originating from foreign entities. The report from CNBC underscores the growing scrutiny of AI applications in sensitive sectors.

The availability of the R1 model underscores the competitive dynamics in the AI industry.

title: This year’s Super Bowl will be full of AI ads
excerpt: The upcoming Super Bowl is expected to feature a significant number of AI-related advertisements, reflecting the growing influence of AI in marketing. The article notes a decrease in ads from Hollywood and streaming companies, suggesting a shift in advertising strategies. This trend highlights the increasing importance of AI in consumer engagement and brand promotion. The presence of AI ads at such a high-profile event underscores the technology's impact on the advertising industry.

title: OpenAI has evidence that its models helped train China’s DeepSeek
excerpt: OpenAI claims to have evidence that its models were used to train China's DeepSeek, highlighting the complex dynamics of AI development and intellectual property. The article discusses the implications of this revelation for international AI competition and the potential challenges in protecting proprietary technologies. OpenAI's findings raise questions about the transparency and ethics of AI training practices, emphasizing the need for clear guidelines and cooperation in the global AI landscape.

title: US Navy jumps the DeepSeek ship.
excerpt: The US Navy has issued a warning to its sailors against using a Chinese startup's AI chatbot, DeepSeek, due to potential security and ethical concerns. This decision follows a report from CNBC highlighting these issues. Additionally, DeepSeek has started limiting user signups as a response to 'malicious attacks.' This move underscores the growing apprehension surrounding AI technologies originating from China, emphasizing the need for caution in their deployment within sensitive sectors.

title: Caption contest.
excerpt: Amidst reports of a strained relationship between OpenAI and Microsoft, Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, shared a selfie with Microsoft's CEO, Satya Nadella. This comes after Nadella's remarks about being 'good for my $80 billion' in response to questions about the Stargate project and AI hype. The image suggests a facade of harmony despite underlying tensions, as both leaders navigate their companies' partnership dynamics.
